title: What should we do after NEET result? - Quora

response.answer_text: There could be two possibilities after the neet results are out. First let's talk about a successful attempt. If you are scoring good marks and you are pretty sure about yourself securing a government seat in the college you have dreamt of Then first thing GO PARTY. ENJOY the happiness of living the moment you have waited for during your strenuous and religious preparation. You have one week before the counselling starts before that grab all the required information as to how to proceed for right college preferences and along with it in this one week you can also visit for a day or two to your favourite place it could be a relative’s house any city trip with your friends or it could be anything. Once the counselling begins go with the procedure and again you have almost one month till the college starts this time is fully yours do whatever you want to do Man. You will be happy because yes you know that you are going to be a doctor. Now let's come to an unfortunate unsuccessful attempt. After giving NEET exam till the date results will be out you have a quite long time. So don't waste this time waiting for results because a candidate gets a pretty clear idea (not exactly though) how's the result is going to be, right after handling the OMR to the invigilator. After checking for the answer key you become pretty sure whether you are going to be selected or not (official answer key could have one or two answers different but Not more than that generally) . So basically now you know what's going to happen at the time of results. So I would suggest you to analyse and take the correct decision of trying once more for the next NEET examination if this was your first attempt (I hv seen droppers becoming toppers) I would definitely recommend you to try once more and devote all that everything you have preparing for the exam once again. Many people think that life of a dropper is sad difficult or depressed but it is never like this because you gotta love the life you live while making the life of your dreams. Society would try to stagnate you. Relatives would compare their children to you and their success stories will torture you but take all these hurdles as your race starts and go ahead start drinking your ncerts again start celebrating the mock tests start enjoying the DC pandey and surely start learning things you left this time so that you don't have to regret again after the next NEET exam. Just keep one thing in mind that the FEAR OF FAILURE should be so tragic that It does not let you sleep more than 6–7 hours per day. PS : I faced the second situation last year. But now I am waiting for good results in neet'19 with my fingers crossed ..

Now that NEET results are declared, the Medical Counselling Committee (MCC) and various state counselling authorities will conduct the counselling of NEET 2018. So now you need to register separately with different counselling authorities for participating in the NEET 2018 counselling process. MCC will conduct the NEET 2018 counselling for admissions to 15% All India Quota (AIQ) seats in Government medical and dental colleges across all states (except J&K), 100% seats in Deemed and Central universities, seats reserved for Wards of Insured Persons (IP quota) in Employees’ State Insurance Corporation (ESIC) medical colleges and seats at the Armed Forces Medical College (AFMC), Pune. NEET counselling 2018 for the remaining 85% state quota seats (100% in case of J&K) in Government medical and dental colleges and seats in other private and self-financing institutions in all states will be conducted by the respective state counselling authorities. For 15% central counselling, you first need to download NEET AIQ rank letters from cbse site( same as where results were declared).Then counselling of NEET 2018 for AIQ seats will be conducted in two rounds in online mode. The procedures are written step by step here below. Candidate Registration: Candidates will be able to register for AIQ first round from June 12, 2018, in online mode. The link to register for AIQ counselling of NEET 2018 will be given below.Choice Filling and Locking (Round 1): After registration, candidates will have to choose the courses and colleges of their preference and finally lock-in their preferences in the online portal.Seat Allotment Result (Round 1):The result of first round of AIQ seat allotment will be published online on the basis of available vacancies and candidate’s choices. Seat allotment result of AIQ first counselling round will also be made available here.Reporting to college against round one allotment: Candidates who will be allotted a seat in NEET AIQ first counselling round, they will be required to either reject the allotted seat or report to the allotted college and complete the admission formalities, before the last date of reporting to college. Candidates who choose to accept the allotted college in round one will also be eligible to participate in NEET 2018 AIQ counselling second round, provided they express their willingness for the same in the online portal.New Registration (Round 2): Before the second round of AIQ counselling of NEET 2018 begins, AIQ registration facility will be open for the candidates who couldn’t register in first round of AIQ counselling.Fresh Choice Filling and Locking (Round 2): Similar to AIQ counselling round one, candidates will be given a chance to enter new choices and prioritize their course and college preference in the portal. Finally candidates will be required to lock their preferences before the last day of locking preferences.Seat Allotment Result (Round 2): MCC will then publish the result of seat allotment of second round of AIQ counselling detailing the ranks admitted on AIQ seats and the colleges in which they got admission.Reporting to college against round two allotment: Candidates who will be allotted a seat in second round of 15% AIQ counselling will not be permitted to vacate their seats as per the orders of the Supreme court of India.NEET Counselling 2018 - Documents Required NEET 2018 Admit CardNEET 2018 Rank Letter or AIQ Rank LetterClass 10 Certificate and Marksheet (for date of birth proof)Class 12 Certificate and MarksheetID ProofEight passport size photographsProvisional allotment letter generated online after allotment.Community Certificate (if applicable).Everything that you want to know about like seat matrix, last year rank vs college can be found in the website of AIPMEEE .Or you may search AIPMEE in google.Hope this helps.
